channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Illegal rocks on verge, one dislodged, ruined my wheel tyre, 27th October
item.description:
Illegal rocks on verge. Â£700+ damage to wheel and tyres. Heading away from leckhampton towards shurdington road. Houses on the left as you go past the dairy before the tree line. Can this be investigated and confirmed for insurance PLUS it illegal

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still potholes in road, 27th October
item.description:
All along Cedar Court Road. Several weeks ago some of the potholes on Cedar Court Road were filled, however there are still significant pot holes and it is unclear why all of the road was not resurfaced. It also appears that some of the tarmac was not properly melted, as a large pothole was filled in, leading to Bathville Mews and there is gravel everywhere, pinging all over the road whenever a car goes over. This did not solve the problem, and some potholes were filled, and one right next to it, was left untouched. This was a really bad repair job.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cedar Court Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 27th October
item.description:
Customer reports that dislodged paving slabs at the location are causing rainwater run-off to flood the basement(s) of the adjacent properties, which have fuse boards and electrics present. They are concerned with the inherent dangers this creates, but add that the slabs are also a trip hazard to pedestrians.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are around 7 pot holes in road, 27th October
item.description:
